data.title: A very nice surprise
data.text: I feel safe calling this a surprise since there are only 9 reviews so far which makes me think that not many people have tried this restaurant. My wife and I are auditing a course this semester and sometimes go to lunch before class. After the waiting in line counter service restaurants where you needed to make a quick decision and then find a place to sit, we decided to try something different. When we entered the gorgeous building and saw the white table cloths, we were expecting to pay much more than we had for fast food. To our surprise we paid about $25 with tip compared to the $16 for two we had been paying. The menu is quite diverse and they have daily specials. I had their grilled fish sandwich with french fries and coleslaw for $10.  Besides very good food, the atmosphere is relaxing. The wait staff tries very hard to please. We will definitely go back.

data.title: Sense and Sensibility
data.text: If you're on the UW Madison campus and are looking for something a cut above the several food carts or ordinary campus fare, head over to the Club for a nice change of pace delicious lunch. With its' stately and historic facade and sedate interior, the restaurant offers you a tranquil setting in which to enjoy the well-prepared food. Outdoor tables also available. Friendly service and great views of the surrounding iconic buildings compliment the experience.

data.title: Reliable lunch spot
data.text: This is a great place near campus to get lunch with a table cloth and linen napkins. Perfect for a business meeting.   Prices are very reasonable, food is very good and service is usually pretty fast.   Service professionalism and attentiveness can be spotty but not a big deal.  You can get in and out during the lunch hour.  Half sandwich and soup for $8 and other items in the low teens.  Love the old distinguished building and ambience.

data.title: Great place for special events
data.text:
We went for a rehearsal dinner and it was very enjoyable.

Service was friendly at both the bar and the tables.

Food served family style with plenty of choices.

data.title: Charming
data.text: Nice place for lunch when you want a quiet casual experience. The waitstaff are college students, so not the best, but the food is good and the price quite reasonable.

data.title: Gorgeous building, but poor service and mediocre food
data.text: I went there for lunch with a friend, and was awed by the architecture. If you like old houses like me, this will be a great place to visit, even for wedding ceremonies. Unfortunately, the service was pretty poor. The server was not attentive, which was surprising since only 10-15% of the tables were occupied. The food was really blend with no flavors and surprises. The fries were okay, the crab cake was really salty and small compared to other places, the bread made in house was stale, and the bread on my sandwich seemed to be dunked in way too much butter. If you are a sandwich and burger person, there are better places than this around town for lunch.

data.title: Tapas on a summer evening
data.text: Lovely place to enjoy the performers/people on Library Mall, view the renovations at the Memorial Union, and see the lake while enjoying tapas and beverages on the front porch veranda.  A Madison summer delight.

data.title: Great Mother's Day brunch
data.text: We were fortunate to get on the waiting list and a cancellation allowed us to enjoy a special Mothers Day brunch here.  Classy old style ambiance with wood paneled dining room and grand piano in the drawing room.  The smoked salmon was terrific. Couscous with dried fruits "middle East oatmeal" delicious new treat.  Also the poached eggs on toast with a spinach cream sauce. Potato pancakes with 3 colors of potatoes tasty.  Unfortunately the roast beef was dry and not very rare.  Hard to do in a warmer tray.  Coq au vin fall- off- the- bone tender so easy to eat. And the Coquille St.Jacques so yummy I  had seconds. The dessert table was not a glot of pies and cakes, which was refreshing. A custard with fruit garnishment, chocolate covered strawberries, and some house made muffins were just the right touch. Everything made in house.  Staff were pleasant and we were unhurried. They are usually only open for breakfast and lunch. They are NOT a private University only eating establishment. Quaint building over 100 years old.

data.title: Pretty Good Fish Fry
data.text: I almost hate revealing that the fish fry at this quiet place is pretty darned good.  This is not a bar fish fry, more like a sit down place for faculty and alums.

data.title: Great place for weddings
data.text: We have been coming here for 20 years. Great views and super nice staff. Walking distance to and from everything! Parking in the ramp.
